head.title: By the Book; The Dance of the Vegetables

hedline.hl1: By the Book; The Dance of the Vegetables

abstract.p: Joost Elffers, creator of illustrated books, comes out with Play With Your Food, with photographs and how-to's for green-pepper goblins, navel orange cats, pear dogs and mice, bell pepper rabbits, yam pigs and mushroom men, in addition to other whimsical vegetable animals; photos (S)

block.p: Joost Elffers may not stand convention on its head, but he comes close. Just look at his sideways take on the jack-o'-lantern, below: by letting the pumpkin stem be the nose, he transforms the traditional, simple-minded smiling face into one filled with expressive possibilities -- funny, threatening, worried, guilty. Mr. Elffers, a creator of illustrated books, applies the same sensibility to the rest of the produce section in ''Play With Your Food'' (Stewart Tabori & Chang, $19.95). With 109 pages of color photographs, the book first amuses, then challenges the imagination and gives the how-to's for green-pepper goblins, navel orange cats, pear dogs and mice, bell pepper rabbits, yam pigs and mushroom men, to name a few creatures in this irresistibly whimsical menagerie.
